decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Grief, then bringing them back onto the battlefield with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The strategy involves using disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces, while also providing additional value with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big, impactful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also controlling the board with cards like Dauthi Voidwalker and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm.

This deck focuses on using creatures and spells to control the board, while also ramping up mana to quickly bring out powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth. The creatures in the deck provide utility and synergy with cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith, allowing for flexible responses to various situations. The inclusion of cards like Gaea's Cradle and Noble Hierarch help to accelerate mana production, while cards like Collector Ouphe disrupt opponent's strategies. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents with strong creatures and efficient control elements.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping out powerful threats such as dragons and goblins while disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void. By utilizing fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Chrome Mox, the deck aims to lock the opponent out of casting spells effectively and overwhelm them with aggressive creatures. With a mix of burn spells and powerful creatures, the deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can establish their game plan.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard, using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. By utilizing cards like Grief and Force of Will for disruption and protection, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Daze and Brazen Borrower adds versatility and control to the deck's game plan, while cards like Wasteland provide additional disruption and mana denial to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on using fast mana acceleration and powerful combo pieces to quickly win the game. By using cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Dark Ritual, the deck aims to cheat out powerful creatures like Thassa's Oracle and Narcomoeba to win the game in one turn. The deck also utilizes cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to win the game as quickly and efficiently as possible through its powerful combo potential.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. It utilizes powerful cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to keep the opponent's threats in check while drawing cards with Brainstorm and Ponder to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value by blinking permanents like Leyline Binding and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. By controlling the board and resources, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in the long game.

This deck focuses on using lands as control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful combos. By utilizing cards like Crop Rotation, Exploration, Life from the Loam, and Wasteland, the deck can quickly assemble key pieces such as Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands like Maze of Ith and Karakas to protect against threats, as well as Punishing Fire for removal. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional value and potential threats for the deck.

The key concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly and cast powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent. Using cards like Throes of Chaos and Violent Outburst to cheat out big creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Apex Devastator. The deck also has ways to protect its combo pieces with Boseiju, Who Endures and Creative Technique. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can react.

This Grixis Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a quick and aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, and Murktide Regent, along with powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will, the deck seeks to outpace and outmuscle opponents. With a strong mix of card advantage, disruption, and efficient creatures, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game throughout. The inclusion of Wasteland and Daze also provides additional disruption and tempo advantage to keep opponents on their back foot.

This Legacy deck focuses on efficiently disrupting the opponent while maintaining pressure through aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler. The deck is designed to control the board with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze while using cards like Lightning Bolt and Murktide Regent to quickly close out games. The mana base is streamlined to maximize consistency and tempo advantage, with access to powerful cards like Brainstorm and Mishra's Bauble to maintain card advantage. The overall strategy is to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's plans.
